title: Can I do a interior design course after btech? - Quora

response.answer_text: COURSES Technically, engineering graduates (or graduates from any other discipline) are eligible to pursue Degree, Diploma or Certificate level interior design courses. After completing Bachelor’s Degree in Interior Design (or relevant graduation course), they may even pursue advanced courses like Master Degree courses, PG Diploma courses and PG Certificate courses related to the field of interior designing. The advantage of pursuing such professional courses is that it helps one acquire advanced knowledge and skills related to the field of interior design. Such courses also helps one specialize in disciplines within the field of interior design. Some prominent courses are – B.Des. (Bachelor of Design) Interior DesignBA Interior DesignB.Sc. Interior DesignBachelor of Architecture and Interior DesignDiploma in Interior DesignDiploma in Architecture and Interior DesignCertificate in Interior DesignCertificate in Interior Design and DecorationNote: Not all professional interior design courses have been listed above. For an exhaustive list, check this article out- Interior Design courses after 12th. It will provide you with an exhaustive list of relevant courses, basic details about the courses and career prospects associated with them. BA and B.Sc. course formats are 3 years long (each). Bachelor of Design (B.Des.) course is 4 years long. Bachelor of Architecture and Interior Design course is 5 years long. Bachelor of Interior Design offered by CEPT University is 5 years long.

Totally depends upon what you see as career. Answer the following, Do you want to design interiors spaces and you feel yourself comfortable with arguing people (clients later on) about what will look good and why, along with functionality ?Do you like to manage your personal space and have a feeling of keeping it better, also you like to be creative by spending time doing some similar stuff ?If yes than you should consider doing interior designing, but don't just opt ID for the ‘future scope thing'

Hello, If you have done B Tec Civil then all you need to do is work as a trainee under a good Interior Designer . If in other fields of B Tec then you should take a 6 months diploma to get a hold of the profession.

Hello Of course, you can definitely pursue a M.Design degree in interior designing irrespective of whatever you’ve pursued in your bachelors. For this I would definitely recommend IILM University, which gives you an open platform disregarding from which background you are!

you can do the course but not entire degree because it consumes more of your time.. from my point of view you just go through diploma in interior so that it doesn't take much more time and as same as it can fulfil your wants
